_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:47:49 using v2.1
title: How has the proportion of respondents not able to contact their care coordinator changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of people who felt they could not contact their care coordinator if they had a problem has remained very low at 4.0% every year. Therefore 96% of users replied that they could always or sometimes contact their care coordinator if they had a problem. This question was not asked in the 2014 survey.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
